summary: The BMW S65 engine, derived from the S85 V10 engine used in the E60 M5, features a 90° V8 configuration with an aluminum construction. It has a displacement of 4.0 L and won the International Engine of the Year award for the 3.0 to 4.0 L category from 2008 to 2012. The engine includes a DOHC valvetrain with variable valve timing, an electronic multi-point fuel injection system, and operates on petrol with a wet sump oil system. Production of the S65 spanned from 2007 to 2013, succeeding the S62 and leading to the S63.
